intro: Faurea macnaughtonii, commonly known as the MacNaughton's faurea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the western United States, particularly found in California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, narrow leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and has a slow growth rate, making it a vulnerable species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
